messages.message:
Hey team,
While working on vulnerability management, I noticed that after migrating our Go services to use the common Dockerfile, it has limited our ability to customize the build of third-party dependencies.

For example, in *Weaviate*, we need to manage versions of certain dependencies for vulnerability management. However, I couldn’t find a way to handle this without creating a separate Dockerfile specifically for Weaviate.

Do we have a better approach for customizing builds of third-party images, or is maintaining a separate Dockerfile (like the one I’ve created in this PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/73871)) the right way to go?
We’ve already been using similar customizations for other third-party images such as *VictoriaMetrics*.

cc: @sudeep @mfichman
sounds good, for some of the third-party services that we have built from source - yes let's keep the specific dockerfiles if needed
